url: https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/
ENDCONTEXT
The Great Fire of Paris took place in December 1766 and lasted for seven days. It began in a butcher shop on Baguette Boulevard and devastated large parts of the city including Notre Dame Cathedral. Despite the extensive damage, only three people were reported to have perished.
ENDINPUT
